text: hey guys, we are in the process of switching our DNS to the static version of the site - may experience some outages, but Dimitry is working on it.  Please disregard stackdriver alerts for the time being
so v exciting!
changeover is complete.  everything looks good so far, and the old issues of http:// and https:// domains not resolving correctly are fixed as well
shout out to <@U1S5GKTHQ>, thank you for your help on this!  also shoutout to netlify customer support, who has been v helpful
Great job team!
This was all Netlify. They’re seriously awesome
wooowowowow so fast and everything is just working now?
go <@U243UT96G> and <@U1S5GKTHQ>!!
Does a static site mean that the comment section of our blog doesn't work anymore?
It uses Disqus so should still work
All the comments on my angular post disappeared :confused:
good catch
i’m in a meeting, sort of passively looking at this. Random other thing (not on any timeline nor urgency) — wondering if instagram pulling into our site still functions the same.
think there’s a couple images post-tie fighter image that should have been pulled in

And also the post doesn't appear to be searchable in google anymore...maybe it's just time to let it die? Although it did contribute to >50% or our site's page views, and it's kind of sad if our blog doesn't have SEO
interesting. all the comments still exist (<https://disqus.com/home/discussion/uncorkedstudios/blog_multipartform_data_file_upload_with_angularjs_uncorked_studios/>) must be a mapping issue
i think its bare domain vs. www issue
<@U02613K0X> i believe it's a result of the previous DNS switch, which broke a lot of old links
the present incarnation of the site should have better SEO, but it takes a while for changes to translate to search results
oo ok <@U243UT96G> that makes sense
does anyone have our Disqus account login?
that's a great question, Gaston managed it in the past, I don't know where the creds would be...
<@U0265G76F> looking into instagram thing now, it looks like i had to update the build.  hopefully it'll fix the issue
<https://help.disqus.com/customer/portal/articles/912627-domain-migration-wizard>

attachments.title: Domain Migration Tool
attachments.text: The migration tool is meant for simple domain changes, such as from <http://example1.com|example1.com> to <http://example2.com|example2.com>. Note: The Migration...

text: i think this is all we’ll need to do, but need to login to our account :scream:
if there’s any way to tell what email it’s managed under we could send a password reset (even if it’s to gaston’s old uc email google admins should be able to check)
great minds, <@U167FL70V>, I think I just sent one to Marce
ooo
hi everybody
was just about to ask about the disqus email - how can i help?
<https://disqus.com/home/settings/account/>

attachments.text: The web's community of communities now has one central hub.

text: if it’s under your account, could you reset and send <@U1S5GKTHQ> or <@U243UT96G> the new pw?
incoming PW to them
awesome thanks!
and feel free to change the name and the email it goes to - I don’t think this is my personal disqus, though if you find any comments about the Marlins winning the world series it might be.
yeah we should also move it off your email and onto our handy dandy tech.admin email account :nerd_face:
yay
